New Records: Harry Kane now has 63 goals for his country, the most in Three Lions history, now 10 clear of the second place Wayne Rooney.
Cole Palmer became just the fifth England player to score his first senior goal for the national team via the penalty spot.
Key Match Events: Cole Palmer got England on their way on the hour mark via the penalty spot.
Trent Alexander-Arnold added a second goal with a sublime volley.
Harry Kane sealed the victory with a third goal in scruffy fashion.
Eberechi Eze was a bright spark in a dull first half and continued to impress in the second period.
Jarrad Branthwaite and Adam Wharton made their debuts for England.
Ezri Konsa blocked Jarrod Bowen's goal-bound shot during the celebrations of the third goal.
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate gave opportunities to players who don't get them too often, with Cole Palmer and Eberechi Eze starting for the first time.
Trent Alexander-Arnold was deployed in midfield, which is what has been expected under Southgate.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate described the match as a good workout and praised the performances of Eze and Palmer.
Harry Kane reflected on the game as a really good preparation and mentioned feeling good after a good week of training.
Cole Palmer expressed his excitement about scoring his first goal for England and hoped he had done enough to make the squad.
Eberechi Eze expressed his gratitude for the opportunity and reflected on his journey and challenges.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at St James' Park, the home of Newcastle United.
The atmosphere at St James' Park was described as buzzing with flags out, hats on, and the sun shining.
A banner at the Gallowgate End referenced the 'Three Lions' hit from Euro 96, saying: 'I know that was then, but it could be again'.
